title: Basic Finger Placement
keyPoints: Use fingertips so notes ring clearly
Fret just behind the metal fret, not on top of it
Keep your thumb centered behind the neck
Press only hard enough for a clean note
Curve fingers to avoid muting other strings
Release pressure between notes to stay relaxed
commonMistakes: Gripping the neck with the thumb over the top
Pressing too far back in the fret
Using too much pressure and tensing up
practiceDrill: Fret each string on the first fret and listen for buzz
Move each finger one fret higher, one at a time
Check thumb position after every finger change
Play a slow 1-2-3-4 pattern on each string
